Pre-Game Insights: Hungary take on the visitors Bosnia & Herzegovina in the round 2 match of UEFA Nations League group stage.
The match will be played on Tuesday, September 10th at Puskás Aréna (Budapest).
Hungary have gradually improved in class and are now rightfully considered a strong team.
Hungary failed to qualify for the World Cup, losing crucial matches leading up to the 2022 tournament.
Hungary managed to secure a spot in Nations League Division A and almost won their elite-level group in the last cycle.
Hungary confidently qualified for the Euros, winning their group with 18 points from 8 matches—4 points ahead of Serbia.
Hungary started the Euros with two clear defeats: 1-3 against Switzerland and 0-2 against Germany.
Hungary managed to snatch a last-minute goal by Csobot to defeat Scotland.
Hungary began the new cycle against Germany and completely collapsed, conceding five unanswered goals.
Bosnia once again disappointed in the last cycle, earning just 9 points from 10 matches and finishing second-to-last in the 2023 qualifiers.
Bosnia started the Nations League against the Netherlands away, where they suffered a defeat more fitting for a hockey game—2-5.
In 1999 and 2001, the teams played friendlies, both ending in draws.
In the Euro 2008 qualifiers, Hungary won both encounters against Bosnia.
Both teams are looking for redemption after humiliations in the first round.
Hungary holds all the advantages—better players, experience, and home-field advantage.
Prediction for the match: Hungary to win.
